summary: Arya and Sansa + Practical Magic AU: “Did you or your sister kill Petyr Baelish?” “Oh yeah. A couple of times.” The Stark...
caption:
Arya and Sansa + Practical Magic AU:

“Did you or your sister kill Petyr Baelish?”

“Oh yeah. A couple of times.”

The Stark sisters were born into a life of magic. After their mother dies of a broken heart the pragmatic Arya swears to never fall in love while the dreamy Sansa can’t wait for romance. A singularly gifted witch, Arya chooses to stay at the Winterfell manor and carry on the family business of witchcraft. Sansa leaves home for an exciting life in the big city where she charms everyone she meets and draws the attention of a mysterious, but dangerous man. He brings dark and unnatural forces into the sisters life. And a young detective. Gendry Waters is investigating the strange circumstances surrounding Arya and she can’t help but be drawn to him too. Together Arya and Sansa will defeat an ancient evil, break the curse…and discover true love.

blog.name: we-are-rogue
blog.title: we are Rogue
blog.description:
Gallery | D&D | Fiction | Theory | Practice | Iconic | Tags and Masterposts

Inspiration and resources for Rogues, the most resourceful player class and fantasy archetype of them all.

Jacks of all trades and masters of none, thieves, outlaws, rascals, scoundrels, pickpockets, cutpurses, cat burglars, bandits, con artists, assassins, infiltrators, highwaymen, spies, swashbucklers, smugglers, pirates, thugs, jesters, tricksters, skillmonkeys, specialists, factotums, and the occasional ronin: we are ROGUE.

blog.name: i-crossed-the-narrow-sea
blog.title: Valar Morghulis
blog.description: I'm here mostly for Arya x Jaqen or Jaqarya, if you prefer, amazing fanfiction authors whose stories help me to deal with the damage the showmakers did to Arya and Jaqen storyline, especially Braavos part. Obsessed with Jaqen H'ghar and Arya Stark and the House of Black and White ;) I love Braavos above all and I hope Arya and Jaqen story will be much better in the next book than what we've got so far in the show. I also love Tyrion  Lannister (really hope he'll get better lines next season), Jon Snow and ser Bronn of the Blackwater. I ship Arya and Jaqen, Tyrion and Tysha (I believe there is hope for them in the book) , Jaime and Brienne, Sansa and Sandor though I also like the idea of Sansa reuniting with Tyrion. I believe Rhaegar Targaryen never raped  Lyanna Stark but saved her from awful Robert Baratheon.

tags: the endless winter of my asoiaf reread
summary: The burning of the town in Arya IV of ACOK is a very good look into what being on the receiving end of a dragon attack would be...
body:
The burning of the town in Arya IV of ACOK is a very good look into what being on the receiving end of a dragon attack would be like.  Arya’s growing panic as the fires grow around her.  The illusions are all there.

“…the flames creeping across its branches until it stood against the night in robes of living orange”

“The night air was full of smoke, and the drifting red embers outnumbered the stars”

“…more torches were flying, trailing long tongues of flame”

“the air was swirling with smoke, the back wall a sheet of fire”

“the fire beat at her back with hot red winds…”

 “Smoke was pouring out the open door like a writhing black snake, and she could hear the screams of the poor animals inside, donkeys, and horses, and men.”

“…it was too hard to breathe, let alone talk”

“Above was nothing but blood and roaring red and choking smoke and the screams of dying horses.”

But it’s the second to last line that confirms to me, that I was right to read this as dragon foreshadowing:

“She heard the sound,  like the roar of some monstrous beast, and a cloud of hot smoke and black dust came billowing up behind her, smelling of hell”

In-universe that’s the barn Arya was just in collapsing, but no that’s a dragon.  And it’s not a very good look for them.

Fire is one of the worst ways to die, and a lot of men are subjected to it that night.  But in the end of the chapter, with Arya safe for now.  Kissing the dirt, tasting “mud and water and worms and life”.

blog.name: i-crossed-the-narrow-sea
blog.title: Valar Morghulis
blog.description: I'm here mostly for Arya x Jaqen or Jaqarya, if you prefer, amazing fanfiction authors whose stories help me to deal with the damage the showmakers did to Arya and Jaqen storyline, especially Braavos part. Obsessed with Jaqen H'ghar and Arya Stark and the House of Black and White ;) I love Braavos above all and I hope Arya and Jaqen story will be much better in the next book than what we've got so far in the show. I also love Tyrion  Lannister (really hope he'll get better lines next season), Jon Snow and ser Bronn of the Blackwater. I ship Arya and Jaqen, Tyrion and Tysha (I believe there is hope for them in the book) , Jaime and Brienne, Sansa and Sandor though I also like the idea of Sansa reuniting with Tyrion. I believe Rhaegar Targaryen never raped  Lyanna Stark but saved her from awful Robert Baratheon.

blog.name: ao3feed-jonrya
blog.title: AO3feed-Jonrya
blog.description: An automated feed for Jon x Arya fics posted on AO3.

title: Starks Will Come Again
description:
by Aryas_aria

Jon Snow awakes on the Wall, changed but still very much committed to freeing “Arya” from the Boltons. Catching wind of Jon’s resurrection, Littlefinger plots to use him to secure Sansa’s seat in Winterfell, but he isn’t the only one with eyes on the North. Back in the Riverlands, a fugitive Brynden Tully finds a mysterious grey- eyed girl at the Twins as Bran Stark returns from Beyond the Wall. Meanwhile, Cersei Lannister rules from King’s Landing as three Dragons circle the island of Dragonstone. The seven kingdoms are at war and the Night King is coming. Will they be able to band together and defeat the Night king for good? Or will the iron Throne be the death of them all?

Words: 919, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death, Underage
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Arya Stark, Sansa Stark, Bran Stark, Rickon Stark, Robb Stark (mentioned) - Character, Ned Stark ( mentioned), Catelyn Tully Stark, Lady Stoneheart, Edmure Tully, The Blackfish, Brynden Tully, Tyrion Lannister, Jamie Lannister, Cersei Lannister, Olenna Tyrell, Willas Tyrell, Margaery Tyrell, Ned Dayne, Arianne Martell, Tyene Sand, Beric Dondarrion (mentioned), Thoros of Myr, Brotherhood Without Banners, Brother(s) of the Night’s Watch, Samwell Tarley, Jon “The Greatjon” Umber, Sandor Clegane, Jon “The Smalljon” Umber, Robert “Sweetrobin” Arryn, Petyr Baelish, Shireen Baratheon, Gendry Waters, Selyse Baratheon, Melisandre of Asshai, Daenerys Targaryen, Aegon VI Targaryen, Theon Greyjoy, Asha Greyjoy, Jaqen H'ghar, The Faceless Man, Gregor Clegane, Brienne of Tarth, Poderick Payne
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen (somewhat), Tyrion Lannister/Sansa Stark, Aegon VI Targaryen/Daenerys Targaryen, Shireen Baratheon/ Gendry waters, Cersei Lannister/ Jaime Lannister
  • Additional Tags: Jon Snow is a Targaryen, Slow Burn, Jon Snow is not called Aegon, aegon is a pretender, Sansa is redeemable, Arya stark is more than a weapon, Arya-centric, Faceless Arya, bran is more than just a three eyed raven, Bran has EMOTIONS & feelings, The Hound has been redeemed, Cersei is evil but we love her for it, Rickon stark is a live and an important member of house stark
